Articles.Content:
A hacky solution to fix the fuel consumption bug in 0.16.0.

A new module (creatively named LiquidFuelEngineFix), based on the LiquidFuelEngine module, fixes the fuel consumption bug.

The Isp values of an engine are multiplied by the throttle percentage to correct for the lower fuel consumption at low throttle settings.

http://www./download.php?v086fsg1erolzgq

Simply change the module type of an engine from LiquidFuelEngine to LiquidFuelEngineFix. Zip file contains changed and unchanged engine types for stock.

Note: The fuel consumption and Isp values obtained when right clicking an engine displays the uncorrected values.

I'v been testing this plugin for a bit, no show stopping bugs, seems to work as advertised.

It has revived my interest in playing this version of KS, thanks.

Which bug is it fixing?

This one: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/15196-0-16-MAJOR-Fuel-consumption-is-wrong-at-low-throttle/
Sigh, now that I found this I feel that I have to play with the bug fixed... Just when I thought my ships were all awesome I am forced to nerf them! Its all your fault!
Awesome thanks. now I can test my designs

Sigh, now that I found this I feel that I have to play with the bug fixed... Just when I thought my ships were all awesome I am forced to nerf them! Its all your fault!

Your ships will lose their awesomeness when you realize in .17 that they don't have the Delta-V to get to orbit. I personally recommend you build your rockets to have about 5,000m/s Delta-V for a Kerbin Orbit Mission.

So this bug fix will be great for you. I'm personally really glad someone fixed that annoying bug.

This fix is amazing. Great plug in! I love making sure I'm being fair now.

I always hated those times when you HAD to run your engine at low throttle and you felt like it was cheating.
Is this fix necessary for Mod Engines to run without the fuel bug? i.e. KW Rocketry, Down Under Aerospace?

Hi, all.

Which (module) engines does fix this? , there are 2 types.

LiquidEngine

LiquidFuelEngine

Oh, btw, what's difference between them?

Thnx

EDIT: Silly me, haven't notice it in post.1st. time. sorry.

Edited September 6, 2012 by elpucko

Your ships will lose their awesomeness when you realize in .17 that they don't have the Delta-V to get to orbit. I personally recommend you build your rockets to have about 5,000m/s Delta-V for a Kerbin Orbit Mission.

So this bug fix will be great for you. I'm personally really glad someone fixed that annoying bug.

I totally agree about fixing the bug, just frustrated that I didn't find out about it till after all my ships were designed! I had to go back to vanilla to trouble shoot some bugs and it felt like I had a cheat mode turned on, my ships were so overpowered without this fix!

Hey, I tried to install it and I did what you said, but when I open KSP it stops loading at "liquidEngine"

Help?

I had the same issue.

Problem: I copied all subdirectories from the "Parts" directory in the fuel fix over to the "Parts" directory in KSP. Doing that, I replaced all subdirectories in there with the ones from the fix. However, the fix only supplies the changed "part.cfg" files, so by replacing the whole directories I accidentally deleted all the other stuff in there. Without all that stuff, KSP freezes on startup at "liquidEngine" without any error message.

Solution: Replace only the "part.cfg" files in the directories instead of the whole directories.

Hi, was just trying to install this mod using WinRAR to extract the .cfg files into the relevant parts folders. I've tried several different ways of doing it, and each time the game either stops loading at liquid engine on the loading screen, or when I go to the VAB or SPH the engines with the edited .cfg files are "not available in this version of KSP". I'm extracting the parts folders into the "parts" folder in "ksp_win" (which is my KSP folder), and I'm extracting the plugin .dll file into the Plugins folder. IS this right? Can we get an install guide?

Thanks

EDIT: Tried moving the plugin .dll file from the Plugin directory to the PluginData directory with no luck. This is what I'm seeing:

EDIT 2: Got it to work. Restored my backup and tried again, just put the plugin .dll into the Plugin directory and just did it all the regular way, which didn't work before, but for some reason this time it seems to have worked. I ran KSP as administrator though.

Edited September 14, 2012 by EpicFishFingers

I did the same thing but now I ONLY have the part.cfg's for the fixed parts D:

Is it possible that someone could give me the vanilla parts?

I could just redownload but with my internet and all the addons I already have installed it wouldn't be worth it
